intro: Euploca styotricha, commonly known as the hairy euploca, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Euploca styotricha is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
